entities.description: Variables that were created from one or more of the edited or recoded variables from the proceeding note.
A period characterized by a severely depressed mood or loss of interest or pleasure in daily activities.
Having a major depressive episode at any time in one's life.
Having a major depressive episode in the past year.
Respondents aged 12 to 17 years who were assessed for major depressive episodes.
Respondents aged 18 years or older who were assessed for major depressive episodes.
A disorder classified under the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fifth Edition.
A medical condition characterized by an impaired ability to stop or control alcohol use despite adverse social, occupational, or health consequences.
Respondents having issues related to hopelessness or being discouraged, one of the diagnostic criteria for MDE.

relationships.description: Relates the NSDUH survey to the variables that were recoded for analysis.
Indicates whether the adolescent respondent had a major depressive episode at any time.
Defines the period during which the respondent experienced major depressive episodes.
Specifies if the major depressive episode occurred in the past year.
Indicates that the adolescent respondents were assessed for major depressive episodes.
Classifies the alcohol use disorder under the DSM-5 disorders.
Indicates that the adult respondents were assessed for major depressive episodes.

triplets.subject: YMDEYR
triplets.object: RC-YOUTH: PAST YEAR MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE (MDE)

triplets.subject: YMDEAU5DYR
triplets.object: RC-YOUTH: PAST YEAR MDE AND ALC USE DISORDER-DSM-5
